abstract: Facebook games “FarmVille” and “Cafe World” have Silicon Valley startups racing to create new ways to pay for virtual goods, a market that may reach $3.6 billion by 2012, Bloomberg News writes.
snippet: Facebook games “FarmVille” and “Cafe World” have Silicon Valley startups racing to create new ways to pay for virtual goods, a market that may reach $3.6 billion by 2012, Bloomberg News writes.
lead_paragraph: The Facebook games “FarmVille” and “Cafe World” have Silicon Valley startups racing to create new ways to pay for virtual goods, a market that may reach $3.6 billion by 2012, Bloomberg News writes.

headline.main: Online Payment Said to Draw Start-Ups
